column8: For In-Person Events: Name of Physical Location
column11: For In-Person Events: Location State (or Province)
column19: Webpage URL for More Information About This Event/Activity (No Links to Google Drive)
column20:
Short Summary (164 Character Limit):*
Tell prospective participants what to expect from your opportunity in a short, friendly sentence. Appears in search results.
column21:
Detailed Description of Opportunity:*
Write a public-friendly description for the web, written for an audience has no idea who you are or what this is.)
column22: Ideal images should reflect the activity participants will experience, rather than a logo. Acceptable "web friendly" formats: png, jpeg, webp. Recommended dimensions: 600×400 pixels.
column24: Select the engagement domain that fits your opportunity best (select ONE)*
column25: Select the activity types that fit your opportunity best (multiselect)*
column29: Select the Venue Type(s) that fit your opportunity best* (leave blank for virtual events)
column30: Select the topic(s) that fit your opportunity best*
column32: Add Keywords/Phrases. Separate with a comma. (e.g. museum, astronomy, afterschool, library, kids, citizen science, nature)
column33: Opportunity Hashtags: When people use social media to talk about and share your opportunity, what hashtags would you like them to use? (e.g. #iowasciencefest21)
column36: Facebook Page (start with http:// or https://)

column20:
Online Aurorasaurus Report-A-Thon, Sat, Sept 20, 1-4pm ET (17:00-20:00 UTC)! Bring your photos with verified locations/times–2024 welcome! Help gather data, ask questions, and hang out with a community of aurora lovers. There will be prizes! 
REGISTER: https://bit.ly/reportsept25
column21: Join fellow aurora chasers, scientists, and aurora enthusiasts for an online Aurorasaurus Report-A-Thon, Sat, Sept 20, 1-4pm ET (17:00-20:00 UTC). Bring your photos with verified locations and times–pix from 2024 are welcome! Help gather data to advance aurora science, ask your questions to experts, and hang out with a community of aurora lovers. There will be prizes! Register at https://bit.ly/reportsept25.
column32: Aurorasaurus, aurora, citizen science, participatory science, NASA, virtual, photography

column1: My NASA Data: Data Literacy for All Webinar
column20: The My NASA Data: Data Literacy for All Webinar highlights Data Literacy Cubes to boost student skills, data understanding, and real-world connections.
column21: As part of the My NASA Data Fall 2025 Webinar Series, join us on Tuesday, September 23rd at 7pm ET for the My NASA Data: Data Literacy for All Webinar.  This first webinar in the series will spotlight tools and resources to enhance Earth science learning in grades 3-12. Dive into the features and educational materials available through the My NASA Data website and learn how to seamlessly integrate them into your classroom. The My NASA Data: Data Literacy for All webinar will focus on the importance of data literacy and explore the Data Literacy Cubes. Learn how to use these versatile tools to develop students' analytical skills, deepen their understanding of data, and connect them to real-world applications.
column30: Computers and technology, Education, General Science, Technology, Mathematics, Geology and Earth Science
column32: webinar, My NASA Data, Data Cubes, Data Literacy, science, educators, webinar, professional development

column1: My NASA Data: Exploring Mini Lessons Webinar
column20: My NASA Data: Exploring Mini Lessons webinar highlights concise, focused activities designed to enhance STEM learning and support curriculum integration.
column21: As part of the My NASA Data Fall 2025 Webinar Series, join us on Tuesday, October 7th at 7pm ET for the My NASA Data: Exploring Mini Lessons Webinar.  This second webinar in the series will spotlight tools and resources to enhance Earth science learning in grades 3-12. Dive into the features and educational materials available through the My NASA Data website and learn how to seamlessly integrate them into your classroom. The My NASA Data: Exploring Mini Lessons webinar will dive into a collection of mini lessons designed to complement and enhance STEM learning. This webinar will demonstrate how to effectively integrate these concise, focused activities into your curriculum.

column1: My NASA Data: Exploring StoryMaps Webinar
column20: My NASA Data: Exploring StoryMaps webinar highlights how StoryMaps and interactives create immersive learning and connect students to NASA Earth science.
column21: As part of the My NASA Data Fall 2025 Webinar Series, join us on Tuesday, October 21st at 7pm ET for the My NASA Data: Exploring StoryMaps Webinar. This third webinar in the series will spotlight tools and resources to enhance Earth science learning in grades 3-12. Dive into the features and educational materials available through the My NASA Data website and learn how to seamlessly integrate them into your classroom. The My NASA Data: Exploring StoryMaps session will explore the world of StoryMaps and interactives, showcasing how these engaging tools can be used to create immersive educational experiences. Learn to harness the power of storytelling with NASA data, while creating meaningful connections to NASA Earth science.

column1: My NASA Data: Exploring Lesson Plans Webinar
column20: My NASA Data: Exploring Lesson Plans webinar highlights classroom-ready lessons that support 3D learning and connect NASA Earth science to phenomena.
column21: As part of the My NASA Data Fall 2025 Webinar Series, join us on Tuesday, November 4th at 7pm ET for the My NASA Data: Exploring Lesson Plans Webinar. This fourth webinar in the series will spotlight tools and resources to enhance Earth science learning in grades 3-12. Dive into the features and educational materials available through the My NASA Data website and learn how to seamlessly integrate them into your classroom. My NASA Data: Exploring Lesson Plans will delve into lesson plans that bring authentic NASA Earth science into the classroom support three-dimensional learning, and help students connect data to phenomena. Discover how to implement these well-structured plans to create meaningful and impactful learning experiences for your students

column1: My NASA Data: A Deep Dive into Data Visualization Webinar
column20: My NASA Data: A Deep Dive into Data Visualization webinar explores the Earth System Data Explorer to enhance instruction with NASA Earth science data.
column21: As part of the My NASA Data Fall 2025 Webinar Series, join us on Tuesday, November 18th at 7pm ET for the My NASA Data: A Deep Dive into Data Visualization Webinar. This final webinar in the series will spotlight tools and resources to enhance Earth science learning in grades 3-12. Dive into the features and educational materials available through the My NASA Data website and learn how to seamlessly integrate them into your classroom. My NASA Data: A Deep Dive into Data Visualization will explore the Earth System Data Explorer, a powerful tool for visualizing and analyzing NASA Earth science data. Discover how to use these visualizations to engage students, deepen their understanding of complex Earth system concepts, and support data-driven instruction.
column30: Computers and technology, Education, General Science, Geology and Earth Science, Mathematics, Technology
